verses.plain: I will praise thee, O LORD, with my whole heart; I will shew forth all thy marvellous works.

tokens.t: I will praise
, O
, with my whole heart; I will shew forth all thy marvellous works.

verses.plain: I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy name, O thou most High.

tokens.t: I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy name, O thou most High.

verses.plain: When mine enemies are turned back, they shall fall and perish at thy presence.

tokens.t: When mine enemies are turned back, they shall fall and perish at thy presence.

verses.plain: For thou hast maintained my right and my cause; thou satest in the throne judging right.

tokens.t: For thou hast maintained my right and my cause; thou satest in the throne judging right.

verses.plain: Thou hast rebuked the heathen, thou hast destroyed the wicked, thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.

tokens.t: Thou hast rebuked the heathen, thou hast destroyed the wicked, thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.

verses.plain: O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end: and thou hast destroyed cities; their memorial is perished with them.

tokens.t: O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end: and thou hast destroyed cities; their memorial is perished with them.

verses.plain: But the LORD shall endure for ever: he hath prepared his throne for judgment.

tokens.t: But the
shall endure for ever: he hath prepared his throne for judgment.

verses.plain: And he shall judge the world in righteousness, he shall minister judgment to the people in uprightness.

tokens.t: And he shall judge the world in righteousness, he shall minister judgment to the people in uprightness.

verses.plain: The LORD also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble.

tokens.t: The
also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble.

verses.plain: And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee: for thou, LORD, hast not forsaken them that seek thee.

tokens.t: And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee: for thou,
, hast not forsaken them that seek thee.

verses.plain: Sing praises to the LORD, which dwelleth in Zion: declare among the people his doings.

tokens.t: Sing praises to the
, which dwelleth in Zion: declare among the people his doings.

verses.plain: When he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them: he forgetteth not the cry of the humble.

tokens.t: When he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them: he forgetteth not the cry of the humble.

verses.plain: Have mercy upon me, O LORD; consider my trouble which I suffer of them that hate me, thou that liftest me up from the gates of death:

tokens.t: Have mercy upon me, O
; consider my trouble
of them that hate me, thou that liftest me up from the gates of death:

verses.plain: That I may shew forth all thy praise in the gates of the daughter of Zion: I will rejoice in thy salvation.

tokens.t: That I may shew forth all thy praise in the gates of the daughter of Zion: I will rejoice in thy salvation.

verses.plain: The heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made: in the net which they hid is their own foot taken.

tokens.t: The heathen are sunk down in the pit
they made: in the net which they hid is their own foot taken.

verses.plain: The LORD is known by the judgment which he executeth: the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion. Selah.

tokens.t: The
is known
the judgment
he executeth: the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion. Selah.

verses.plain: The wicked shall be turned into hell, and all the nations that forget God.

tokens.t: The wicked shall be turned into hell,
all the nations that forget God.

verses.plain: For the needy shall not alway be forgotten: the expectation of the poor shall not perish for ever.

tokens.t: For the needy shall not alway be forgotten: the expectation of the poor shall
perish for ever.

verses.plain: Arise, O LORD; let not man prevail: let the heathen be judged in thy sight.

tokens.t: Arise, O
; let not man prevail: let the heathen be judged in thy sight.

verses.plain: Put them in fear, O LORD: that the nations may know themselves to be but men. Selah.

tokens.t: Put them in fear, O
the nations may know themselves
men. Selah.

footnotes.text: judging right: Heb. judging in righteousness
O thou…: or, The destructions of the enemy are come to a perpetual end: and their cities hast thou destroyed, etc
a refuge: Heb. an high place
